intro: Dissotis hensii, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it grows in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Dissotis hensii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
